20101210180724.000|20101210180726.000|CCO|REASON OF INSANITY HAS FAILED.

20101210180728.000|20101210180730.000|CCO|LOGICAL OUTCOMES OF THAT?
20101210180730.000|20101210180732.000|CCO|WHAT HAPPENS?
20101210180732.000|20101210180733.429|CCO|DOES HE HAVE APPEAL RIGHTS NOW?
20101210180733.429|20101210180734.857|CCO|>> YES.
20101210180734.857|20101210180736.286|CCO|THE NEXT PHASE WILL BE THE 
20101210180736.286|20101210180737.714|CCO|SENTENCING BY THE JUDGE.

20101210180739.143|20101210180740.571|CCO|THAT WILL NOT HAPPEN TODAY.

20101210180753.250|20101210180754.500|CCO|BECAUSE THERE ARE SENTENCING 
20101210180754.500|20101210180755.750|CCO|GUIDELINES.
20101210180755.750|20101210180757.000|CCO|THE JUDGE WILL CALL FOR 
20101210180757.000|20101210180758.250|CCO|SUBMISSIONS ON WHAT SORT OF 
20101210180758.250|20101210180759.500|CCO|SENTENCE SHOULD BE IMPOSED?
20101210180759.500|20101210180800.750|CCO|>> EXACTLY.
20101210180800.750|20101210180802.000|CCO|FEDERAL COURTS ARE DIFFERENT 
20101210180802.000|20101210180804.500|CCO|FROM STATE COURTS IN THAT
